channel.title: TabView
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "TabView" - HELP!

item.title: Re: TabView
item.content:encoded:
Well I found my answer…

"Tabs will accept any content, but at the moment it is not possible to nest tabviews."

item.title: Re: TabView
item.content:encoded:
• Title of Tab No. 1
  • Title of Tab No. 1.2
  • Title of Tab No. 1.3

Content of Tab No. 1.

  • Title of Tab No. 1.1
  • Title of Tab No. 2
  • Title of Tab No. 3

  • Title of Tab No. 2.3

  • Title of Tab No. 3.1
  • Title of Tab No. 3.2
  • Title of Tab No. 3.3

Content of Tab No. 3.1.

Content of Tab No. 3.2.

Okay… what the heck did I do differently here??
It is not quite working, since the main tabs do not have anything in them like they should…
Yeah, this is definitely not working correctly :(

item.title: TabView
item.content:encoded:
Basically I am looking for help with a layout.

 [[tabview]] [[tab Title of Tab No. 1]] Content of Tab No. 1. [[/tab]] [[tab Title of Tab No. 2]] Content of Tab No. 2. [[/tab]] [[tab Title of Tab No. 3]] Content of Tab No. 3. [[/tab]] [[/tabview]]

This works wonderfully for breaking up seasons, see my character page for an example: Taliesan. However, what I am trying to do now is have another set of tabs nested inside my large over arching season tabs. Basically I want to break up my item list into 3 categories and this would be the best way to view them all. The problem is when I put them inside it is not interpreted properly. Any of you Wiki-ites have any ideas?

I have read the discussion here: http://snippets.wikidot.com/code:tabs
However, it was not any help to my question, except one person mentioned that they got it to work…
